item.title: kirkesque add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Literature was not born the day when a boy crying "wolf, wolf" came running out of the Neanderthal valley with a big gray wolf at his heels; literature was born on the day when a boy came crying "wolf, wolf" and there was no wolf behind him." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: kirkesque add a quote by Mikhail Bulgakov
item.description: "Love leaped out in front of us like a murderer in an alley leaping out of nowhere, and struck us both at once. As lightning strikes, as a Finnish knife strikes! She, by the way, insisted afterwards that it wasn’t so, that we had, of course, loved each other for a long, long time, without knowing each other, never having seen each other… " -- Mikhail Bulgakov

item.title: kirkesque add a quote by Mikhail Bulgakov
item.description: "manuscripts don't burn" - "(рукописи не горят)" -- Mikhail Bulgakov

item.title: kirkesque add a quote by Suzanne Massie
item.description: "All the devil asks is acquiescence; not conflict, not struggle. Acquiescence." -- Suzanne Massie
